title: polymerbit
author: polymerbit
created_time: January 13, 2023, 03:08:28 AMLast edit: January 13, 2023, 01:45:07 PM by polymerbit
content: I apologise for the informal manner of this thread...but time is of the essence. As you know, there is a situation with ColdKey. Speculation is rife; and there is evidence of private keys being compromised. For the safety of our clients, I'm releasing this PSA. We recommend to peel any ten year anniversary notes immediately. We are offering a trade in program, read in the comments. Early 2019, 21 pcs, loaded.The keys on these notes were not made in house, and we cannot verify the integrity at this time. ----------No other polymerbit notes are affected.

comments.author: LitLitBit
comments.body: I don’t own many bitcoin collectibles. I’m new to this hobby. I bought a Titan (compromised). A coldkey collection (compromised). I also own 1 polymerbit note, its this one (compromised). The fucking trifecta. I’ll be selling all my collectibles over the next few days/weeks. Well done guys you got me good.

comments.author: polymerbit
comments.body: Quote from: LitLitBit on January 13, 2023, 03:16:59 AMI don’t own many bitcoin collectibles. I’m new to this hobby. I bought a Titan (compromised). A coldkey collection (compromised). I also own 1 polymerbit note, its this one (compromised). The fucking trifecta. I’ll be selling all my collectibles over the next few days/weeks. Well done guys you got me good. From the information we have gathered, the keys at this time are intact.We are recommending this action to err on the side of caution.

comments.author: LitLitBit
comments.body: Quote from: polymerbit on January 13, 2023, 03:25:59 AMQuote from: LitLitBit on January 13, 2023, 03:16:59 AMI don’t own many bitcoin collectibles. I’m new to this hobby. I bought a Titan (compromised). A coldkey collection (compromised). I also own 1 polymerbit note, its this one (compromised). The fucking trifecta. I’ll be selling all my collectibles over the next few days/weeks. Well done guys you got me good. From the information we have gathered, the keys at this time are intact.We are recommending this action to err on the side of caution. To be clear I’m not upset with Polymerbit. I just don’t need the aggravation, stress and negativity that this place is riddled with. Nothing but scammers and thieves. No thanks. I’d rather go touch grass.

I just don’t need the aggravation, stress and negativity that this place is riddled with. Nothing but scammers and thieves. No thanks. I’d rather go touch grass. Read clearly , Priva key was done by JOGG..

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Oh no. Almost forgot about these. I loved these notes and paid a massive premium in a previous auction. ffsThanks for bringing this to our attention, polymerbit!

comments.author: polymerbit
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on January 13, 2023, 12:54:25 PMOh no. Almost forgot about these. I loved these notes and paid a massive premium in a previous auction. ffsThanks for bringing this to our attention, polymerbit!Because of the loss of value, we've decided to offer the following. I know it cannot replace it fully, but I hope it helps to compensate. Anyone who owns one of these notes, and have peeled it due to the crisis... we will offer a trade in program. We will accept these notes in return for either 1) a $100 polymerbit gift card, or 2) an updated version of this note in clear window, with our keys (unloaded). The gift card will be valid for the life of the company and can be sent/sold to other users. The note will bear the serial number of your peeled note in red, with a star.

comments.author: Xprim777
comments.body: As I also appear on the back of the note, I would like to say that I am not related to the private keys generation, nor to any other "technical" things on this edition. I was with him when these were produced. I'm pretty sure the notes are safe and there's no private keys backup, but who knows, I'm shocked by what has just happened

Never a sad day in Physical Crypto collectible world. Always a savior..Kudos to polymerbit for doing this…

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Well guys, I'll be the Guinea pig here, since I'm not peeling this damn note. Why? Because I have lost thousands overnight already, so fuck it... Plus I love this damn note, it's awesome! My note: #AA006 - Funding address: https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/address/1GX8LezPX4WdYB8HNwueCquUQYQSWDDEDwThanks again Daniele for your phone call last night, I very much appreciate it my friend. owlcatz

comments.author: Agrawas
comments.body: I peeled mine.. i have an extremely small and lower denomination collection. Something like this feels like big chunk of my btc gone, especially when these kinda collectibles has more value in premiums than the actual load amount. Destroying about 20 coldkeys valuing at load value of .13btc is almost like loosing about .4BTC..It’s not much for some OGs but big hole in the wallet for the new members..

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Agrawas on January 13, 2023, 05:01:00 PMI peeled mine.. i have an extremely small and lower denomination collection. Something like this feels like big chunk of my btc gone, especially when these kinda collectibles has more value in premiums than the actual load amount. Destroying about 20 coldkeys valuing at load value of .13btc is almost like loosing about .4BTC..It’s not much for some OGs but big hole in the wallet for the new members..I think peeling anything related to Yogg is the right thing to do. However, I’d be surprised if there are more coins he could steal that he hasn’t already. Another thing I would say to caution folks is to take a good look at the design style and the manufacturing techniques used. I would bet that if he did this to you all now, he’s likely already hard at work pushing other loaded products to the community using an alt that will eventually be rug pulled. Be safe and be suspicious of anyone trying to sell you preloaded goods.

comments.author: SatoshJr
comments.body: I was lucky enough to win a raffle to then be able to purchase one of these notes. I remember feeling excited about owning a loaded polymerbit.Now, I don't know if I should peel it. This is a sad day for the community, and Yogg has truly destroyed many years of trust that took many more to build.But something I also noticed today is that the community has bonded and become stronger in many ways. Thank you Polymerbit for offering this solution! You are truly one of the greats.

comments.author: BitcoinPenny
comments.body: Since (1) I collect Polymerbit notes, and (2) I hate to see these notes peeled, please feel free to hit me up if you have one of these Yogg-compromised notes. I'll take it off your hands.Regards,Chris@TBPCo.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: I also would be willing to buy one and pay the $50 load value on top of the note value

comments.author: polymerbit
comments.body: If you haven't done so already. Peel now!

comments.author: Edits
comments.body: Yogg is really the gift that keeps on giving (sweeping)

comments.author: montreal1
comments.body: unrelated - but any new polymerbit releases in the works? really like the ones I got

comments.author: polymerbit
comments.body: Quote from: Edits on April 08, 2023, 12:32:14 PMYogg is really the gift that keeps on giving (sweeping)The notes are still intact at this time. We however have no way of guaranteeing they will remain loaded. This is why we are strongly advising to redeem.

comments.author: polymerbit
comments.body: Quote from: montreal1 on April 08, 2023, 02:54:11 PMunrelated - but any new polymerbit releases in the works? really like the ones I gotYes there are, we have been working on our clear window tech. I'm also excited for Bitcoin 2023 (Miami) and have been quite busy preparing notes for this.
